title: Customizing Plots
content:
# Customizing Plots

Making your plots publication-ready.

## Labels and Titles

```python
plt.title("Global Warming Data", fontsize=16, fontweight='bold')
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Temperature Anomaly")
```

## Legends

```python
plt.plot(x, y1, label='Model A')
plt.plot(x, y2, label='Model B')
plt.legend(loc='upper left', frameon=False)
```

## Ticks and Grids

```python
plt.grid(True, linestyle='--', alpha=0.6)
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.xlim(0, 100) # Set axis limits
```

## Styles

Matplotlib comes with pre-defined styles.

```python
print(plt.style.available)
plt.style.use('seaborn-v0_8-whitegrid')
```

## Annotations

Add text or arrows to highlight points.

```python
plt.annotate('Peak', xy=(x_max, y_max), xytext=(x_max+1, y_max+1),
             arrowprops=dict(facecolor='black', shrink=0.05))
```
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.style.use('classic')
plt.plot([1, 2, 3], [1, 4, 9])
plt.title("Classic Style")
